column4: i just downloaded limewire but i guess ubuntu can't read rpm files?
!frostwire
!alien
alien is dangerous?
lol
hmm

be careful with LimeWire, I gave up using it becuase there's mostly a load of rubbish on there, but also a load of bots that wait and monitor what you are searching for, and then they rename images and trojan infected .exe's to match waht you are looking for to make unwary users download and infect their (predominantly)Windows boxes.
does it really matter though?
because linux has no viruses right?
and ones that were made stayed in the development labs

depends upon what you want from gnutella though, The gnutella network is mostly full of dodgy porn and pirated rubbish.  You can end up wasting more time that it's worth.  Linux has a few "proof-of-concpet" viruses, but crrently nothing to really worry about.  I just don't personally value anything that you can find on Gnutella, that's all.
lol
Is there any other p2p program you use byetcode?
and I'm just saying "be careful" especially if it's not a homogenous linux netwrk that you're on.
ok
i installed bittornado

Lethalsword: it's not the program that's the problem, LimeWire seems pretty good as a client, it's just that the network isn't exactly crammed with bonafide content, and there are a lot of "people" and bots out there that have ulterior motives behind what they are sharing.

I've lost count of the number of times that I've ended up downloading what ends up being a JPG of an advert for some dodgy website or other, because a Bot has decided to pick up my search terms and rename it's dodgy Jpeg to make me thionk that it's a genuine search result.
that sucks
but the new limewire has content filtering
have you looked at http://www.legaltorrents.com/index.htm and used bittorrent?
